Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a game-tying home run in the sixth inning after an 11-pitch at-bat.
David Peterson pitched seven solid innings, including a crucial double play ball in the seventh.
Jesse Winker hit a 100 mph fastball into the left-center-field gap in the ninth inning.
Jose Iglesias hit a 102 mph pitch off Geraldo Perdomo’s glove to give the Mets a lead.
José Buttó gave the Mets a scoreless inning.
Edwin Díaz nailed down the save in a dominant ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed satisfaction with the team's at-bats.
Jose Iglesias emphasized the importance of putting the ball in play.
Edwin Díaz highlighted the importance of his performance for the team's playoff hopes.
Carlos Mendoza stated, 'We’re up to the competition. And now, we’ve got to get ready for another good series.'
